debounce_ignore.description: Protects unique payload values of specified payload properties from overriding within debounce time
debounce_ignore.title: Ignore debounce

filtered_optimistic.description: Filter attributes from optimistic publish payload when calling /set. (This has no effect if optimistic is set to false).
filtered_optimistic.title: Filtered optimistic attributes

friendly_name.description: Used in the MQTT topic of a device. By default this is the device ID
friendly_name.title: Friendly name

icon.description: The user-defined device icon for the frontend. It can be a link to an image (not a path to a file) or base64 encoded data URL like: image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB3aW....R0aD
icon.title: Icon

qos.description: QoS level for MQTT messages of this device
qos.title: QoS

retain.description: Retain MQTT messages of this device
retain.title: Retain

retention.description: Sets the MQTT Message Expiry in seconds, Make sure to set mqtt.version to 5
retention.title: Retention

adapter_concurrent.description: Adapter concurrency (e.g. 2 for CC2531 or 16 for CC26X2R1) (default: null, uses recommended value)
adapter_concurrent.title: Adapter concurrency

baudrate.description: Baud rate speed for serial port, this can be anything firmware support but default is 115200 for Z-Stack and EZSP, 38400 for Deconz, however note that some EZSP firmware need 57600
baudrate.title: Baudrate

cache_state.description: MQTT message payload will contain all attributes, not only changed ones. Has to be true when integrating via Home Assistant
cache_state.title: Cache state

cache_state_persistent.description: Persist cached state, only used when cache_state: true
cache_state_persistent.title: Persist cache state

cache_state_send_on_startup.description: Send cached state on startup, only used when cache_state: true
cache_state_send_on_startup.title: Send cached state on startup

channel.description: Zigbee channel, changing requires repairing all devices! (Note: use a ZLL channel: 11, 15, 20, or 25 to avoid Problems)
channel.title: ZigBee channel

elapsed.description: Add an elapsed attribute to MQTT messages, contains milliseconds since the previous msg
elapsed.title: Elapsed

ext_pan_id.description: Zigbee extended pan ID, changing requires repairing all devices!
ext_pan_id.title: Ext Pan ID

homeassistant_legacy_entity_attributes.description: Home Assistant legacy entity attributes, when enabled Zigbee2MQTT will add state attributes to each entity, additional to the separate entities and devices it already creates
homeassistant_legacy_entity_attributes.title: Home Assistant legacy entity attributes

homeassistant_legacy_triggers.description: Home Assistant legacy triggers, when enabled Zigbee2mqt will send an empty 'action' or 'click' after one has been send. A 'sensor_action' and 'sensor_click' will be discoverd
homeassistant_legacy_triggers.title: Home Assistant legacy triggers

ikea_ota_use_test_url.description: Use IKEA TRADFRI OTA test server, see OTA updates documentation
ikea_ota_use_test_url.title: IKEA TRADFRI OTA use test url

last_seen.description: Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messages, contains date/time of last Zigbee message
last_seen.title: Last seen

log_file.description: Log file name, can also contain timestamp
log_file.title: Log file

log_output.description: Output location of the log, leave empty to supress logging
log_output.title: Log output

log_symlink_current.description: Create symlink to current logs in the log directory
log_symlink_current.title: Log symlink current

app_name.description: The name of the application (Default: Zigbee2MQTT).
app_name.title: Localhost

eol.description: The end of line character to be added to the end of the message (Default: Message without modifications).
eol.title: eol

host.description: The host running syslogd, defaults to localhost.
host.title: Host

localhost.description: Host to indicate that log messages are coming from (Default: localhost).
localhost.title: Localhost

path.description: The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e. /dev/log or /var/run/syslog for OS X).
path.title: Path

pid.description: PID of the process that log messages are coming from (Default process.pid).
pid.title: PID

port.description: The port on the host that syslog is running on, defaults to syslogd's default port.
port.title: Port

protocol.description: The network protocol to log over (e.g. tcp4, udp4, tls4, unix, unix-connect, etc).
protocol.title: Protocol

type.description: The type of the syslog protocol to use (Default: BSD, also valid: 5424).
type.title: Type

network_key.description: Network encryption key, changing requires repairing all devices!
network_key.title: Network key

pan_id.description: ZigBee pan ID, changing requires repairing all devices!
pan_id.title: Pan ID

rtscts.description: RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for serial port
rtscts.title: RTS / CTS

timeout.description: Time after which an active device will be marked as offline in minutes
timeout.title: Timeout

timeout.description: Time after which an passive device will be marked as offline in minutes
timeout.title: Timeout

blocklist.description: Block devices from the network (by ieeeAddr)
blocklist.title: Blocklist

output.description: Examples when 'state' of a device is published json: topic: 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb' payload '{"state": "ON"}' attribute: topic 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb/state' payload 'ON' attribute_and_json: both json and attribute (see above)
output.title: MQTT output type

transmit_power.description: Transmit power of adapter, only available for Z-Stack (CC253*/CC2652/CC1352) adapters, CC2652 = 5dbm, CC1352 max is = 20dbm (5dbm default)
transmit_power.title: Transmit power

external_converters.description: You can define external converters to e.g. add support for a DiY device
external_converters.title: External converters

base_topic.description: MQTT base topic for Zigbee2MQTT MQTT messages
base_topic.title: Base topic

ca.description: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of CA used to sign server and client certificates
ca.title: Certificate authority

cert.description: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for client-authentication
cert.title: SSL/TLS certificate

force_disable_retain.description: Disable retain for all send messages. ONLY enable if you MQTT broker doesn't support retained message (e.g. AWS IoT core, Azure IoT Hub, Google Cloud IoT core, IBM Watson IoT Platform). Enabling will break the Home Assistant integration
force_disable_retain.title: Force disable retain

include_device_information.description: Include device information to mqtt messages
include_device_information.title: Include device information

key.description: Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-authentication
key.title: SSL/TLS key

server.description: MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TLS connection)
server.title: MQTT server

disable_automatic_update_check.description: Zigbee devices may request a firmware update, and do so frequently, causing Zigbee2MQTT to reach out to third party servers. If you disable these device initiated checks, you can still initiate a firmware update check manually.
disable_automatic_update_check.title: Disable automatic update check

update_check_interval.description: Your device may request a check for a new firmware update. This value determines how frequently third party servers may actually be contacted to look for firmware updates. The value is set in minutes, and the default is 1 day.
update_check_interval.title: Update check interval

passlist.description: Allow only certain devices to join the network (by ieeeAddr). Note that all devices not on the passlist will be removed from the network!
passlist.title: Passlist

permit_join.description: Allow new devices to join (re-applied at restart)
permit_join.title: Permit join

adapter.description: Adapter type, not needed unless you are experiencing problems
adapter.title: Adapter

disable_led.description: Disable LED of the adapter if supported
disable_led.title: Disable led

port.description: Location of the adapter. To autodetect the port, set null
port.title: Port

options.description: Set to false to disable the legacy integration (highly recommended), will change structure of the published payload (default true).
options.name: legacy

definition.description: Hue white and color ambiance E26/E27/E14

features.description: Color temperature after cold power on of this light
features.name: color_temp_startup

presets.description: Restore previous color_temp on cold power on
presets.name: previous

features.description: Color of this light in the CIE 1931 color space (x/y)
features.name: color_xy

features.description: Color of this light expressed as hue/saturation
features.name: color_hs

exposes.description: Triggers an effect on the light (e.g. make light blink for a few seconds)
exposes.name: effect

options.description: Controls the transition time (in seconds) of on/off, brightness, color temperature (if applicable) and color (if applicable) changes. Defaults to `0` (no transition).
options.name: transition

options.description: When enabled colors will be synced, e.g. if the light supports both color x/y and color temperature a conversion from color x/y to color temperature will be done when setting the x/y color (default true).
options.name: color_sync

definition.description: Hue white and color ambiance E26/E27/E14

features.name: color_temp_startup

presets.description: Restore previous color_temp on cold power on
presets.name: previous

exposes.name: effect

options.description: Controls the transition time (in seconds) of on/off, brightness, color temperature (if applicable) and color (if applicable) changes. Defaults to `0` (no transition).
options.name: transition

options.description: When enabled colors will be synced, e.g. if the light supports both color x/y and color temperature a conversion from color x/y to color temperature will be done when setting the x/y color (default true).
options.name: color_sync

exposes.description: Voltage of the battery in millivolts
exposes.name: voltage

options.description: The WXKG01LM only reports a button press and release.By default, a hold action is published when there is at least 1000 ms between both events. It could be that due to delays in the network the release message is received late. This causes a single click to be identified as a hold action. If you are experiencing this you can try experimenting with this option (e.g. set it to 2000) (value is in ms).
options.name: hold_timeout

options.description: Sometimes it happens that the button does not send a release. To avoid problems a release is automatically send after a timeout. The default timeout is 4000 ms, you can increase it with this option (value is in ms).
options.name: hold_timeout_expire

options.description: Set to false to disable the legacy integration (highly recommended), will change structure of the published payload (default true).
options.name: legacy

exposes.description: Indicates whether the device detected vibration
exposes.name: vibration

exposes.description: Voltage of the battery in millivolts
exposes.name: voltage

options.description: Time in seconds after which vibration is cleared after detecting it (default 90 seconds).
options.name: vibration_timeout

exposes.description: Voltage of the battery in millivolts
exposes.name: voltage

options.description: Number of digits after decimal point for pressure, takes into effect on next report of device.
options.name: pressure_precision

options.description: Calibrates the pressure value (absolute offset), takes into effect on next report of device.
